TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi RibbonButton extends System.Windows.Controls.Button

Docs.summary: Represents a button that is used in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonButton> controls in large, medium, and small variations, and with no images.
![Ribbon button controls](~/add/media/wpfribbon-button.png "Ribbon button controls") Ribbon button controls
The following illustration shows how a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonButton> appears when the mouse pointer is moved over it.
![Ribbon button controls with highlight](~/add/media/wpfribbon-button-selection.png "Ribbon button controls with highlight") Ribbon button controls with highlight
## Examples The following example shows the markup to create the first button.
[!code-xaml[Ribbon_ControlsSample#RibbonButton](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ribbon_controlssample/cs/mainwindow.xaml#ribbonbutton)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ KeyTip { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.KeyTip : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the control.
Docs.value: The keyboard shortcut for the control. The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks A KeyTip must be from 1 to 3 uppercase characters, and must not contain spaces, tabs, or newline characters. KeyTips are sometimes known as access keys or accelerators and are used as shortcut key combinations that activate controls. KeyTips appear on the when you press the ALT key. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnApplyTemplate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Builds the visual tree for the when a new template is applied.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnClick() cil managed

Docs.summary: Handles the event and raises the attached event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method calls the base method and then raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlService.DismissPopup?displayProperty=nameWithType> attached event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnGotKeyboardFocus(class System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnGotKeyboardFocus (e As KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs)

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event and enables the keyboard focus visual when this control gets keyboard focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides the default behavior and enables the keyboard focus visual when this control gets keyboard focus.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.GotKeyboardFocus> event data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnKeyTipAccessed(class System.Windows.Controls.KeyTipAccessedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnKeyTipAccessed (e As KeyTipAccessedEventArgs)
abstract member OnKeyTipAccessed : System.Windows.Controls.KeyTipAccessedEventArgs -> unit override this.OnKeyTipAccessed : System.Windows.Controls.KeyTipAccessedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.summary: Called when the KeyTip or accelerator key is accessed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnLostKeyboardFocus(class System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnLostKeyboardFocus (e As KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs)

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event and disables the keyboard focus visual when this control loses keyboard focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides the default behavior and disables the keyboard focus visual when this control loses keyboard focus.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostKeyboardFocus> event data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseLeftButtonDown(class System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnMouseLeftButtonDown (e As MouseButtonEventArgs)

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the routed event to prevent the control from receiving keyboard focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> should not take keyboard focus from the application. This method overrides the default behavior and temporarily sets the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A> property to `false`, which prevents the control from taking keyboard focus. It then calls the base method.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown> event data.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the descriptive text that is displayed in the ToolTip for this control.
Docs.value: The descriptive text to display in the ToolTip. The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!WARNING] > Each ribbon control inherits a property. If the property is set, the ribbon's enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows the markup used to create the enhanced ToolTip. ![Enhanced ToolTip](~/add/media/wpfribbon-tooltipenhanced.png "Enhanced ToolTip") Enhanced ToolTip [!code-xaml[Ribbon_ControlsSample#RibbonButtonTT](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ribbon_controlssample/cs/mainwindow.xaml#ribbonbuttontt)]
